title: Calories in Meatloaf
meta_description: Learn calories in meatloaf per slice (100g), including protein, carbs, fat, and full nutrition facts for easy tracking.
assumptions: Homemade beef meatloaf with ground beef (80/20), breadcrumbs, egg, onions, and seasonings; baked. One slice â‰ˆ100g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, meat type, portion size, and cooking method. Check labels for store-bought varieties.

quick_answer.text: One slice of meatloaf (100g) provides about 220 kcal and 20g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use lean ground turkey instead of beef
Add ketchup and brown sugar glaze

faqs.q: How many calories in one slice of meatloaf?
faqs.a: About 220 kcal for a standard 100g slice of homemade beef meatloaf.

faqs.q: What is the protein content in meatloaf?
faqs.a: One 100g slice has roughly 20g of protein.

faqs.q: Does meatloaf have a lot of carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, around 10g carbs per 100g slice, mainly from breadcrumbs.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in meatloaf?
faqs.a: Baking keeps it lower; frying or adding oil increases calories by 20-50 kcal per slice.

faqs.q: What are calories in turkey meatloaf?
faqs.a: Lower at about 170 kcal per 100g slice compared to beef.
